_header: Listeneth now I will you tell / Of mickle pity I may you spell

BodAsh61.First Lines:
Lystyns lordynges I wyll ȝow tellOff mekyll pete I may
                    ȝou spellOff Ihesu þat vs All hath wrouȝtAnd seth oure
                    saules dere hath bouȝt…
BodAsh61.Last Lines:
…And þat it myȝht so beAmen Amen for
                    charyte
BodAsh61.Editions:
Shuffleton,  George. 
             Ashmole 61: A Compilation of Popular Middle English Verse.
         Kalamazoo, MI: Western Michigan University for TEAMS, 2008: 232-74; 512-21; 611-15.

BodRawC86.First Lines:
Off gostly Maters I wyll meveTo yow that are in cristis
                    Beleve…
BodRawC86.Last Lines:
…An C dayes also off Indulgence and pardonAnd godde off
                    hevynis dere Benysvn
BodRawC86.Attributed Title:
ffinitur iste liber Sit scriptor liber (f. 30v);
                        Explicit passio domini nostri Ihesu cristi composita a quodam
                        sapientissimo in materna lingua videlicet anglicorum hominibus non
                        intelligentibus scripturarum sensus (f. 30v)

BodRawC655.First Lines:
Ale þat leueþ on ihesu cristVor his loue þanne
                    hauþ list…
BodRawC655.Last Lines:
…þat ys to ȝo blysse of heuonAmen fore hys manis
                    seuen
BodRawC655.Note:
Includes extracts totalling 260 lines from 4970. At the end: ‘Explycit hic totum pro
                    christo da mihi potum’.

CULDd11.First Lines:
…and a man he smot riht thohis riht ere he nam him
                    fro…
CULDd11.Last Lines:
…þat is to þe blisse of heueneAmen for his namys
                    seuene amen
CULDd11.Attributed Title: Explicit passio domini nostri ihesu cristi (f. 21)
CULDd11.Editions:
Foster,  Frances Allen,
                        ed.  
             The Northern Passion.
EETS
         o.s. 145, 147 (1913, 1916); repr. 1971: (with collation of other MSS).

CULFf548.First Lines:
Herkyns now if ye wille hereOff mycull pyte ye mow
                    lere…
CULFf548.Last Lines:
…Þat is to þe blisse of heueAmen for his names
                    seuen
CULFf548.Attributed Title:
Passio domini (f. 11); Explicit Passio Domini nostri ihesu cristi
                        Quod Dominus Gilbertus Pylkyngton Amen (f. 43)
CULFf548.Editions:
Downing,  Janay Young A.,
                        ed.  
             “A Critical Edition of Cambridge University MS Ff.5.48.” 
         2 vols. Diss. University of Washington, 1969: 186-95.

CULGg11.First Lines:
HErknith alle the wolle þou telleOf muche pitie in mi
                    spelle…
CULGg11.Last Lines:
…Þat is to þe blisse of heueneAmen for his names
                    seuene
CULGg11.Editions:
Heuser,  Wilhelm,  and  Frances Allen Foster, eds.  
             The Northern Passion (Supplement).
EETS
         o.s. 183 (1930); repr. 1971: 1-50.

CULGg112.First Lines:
Lesnet no I wille you telleOf michil pyte I may you
                    spele…
CULGg112.Last Lines:
…has mayset marc and luc and Jonhave he corden to
                    hom…
CULGg112.Note:
Ten lines addded to original blank space at end of the major text;
                    incomplete.

CULGg531.First Lines:
Lystenys now I wyll ȝowe tellOf mykell pyte I may ȝow
                    spell…
CULGg531.Last Lines:
…ffor þat is to þe blys of heuynAmen for ȝhoure
                    hames seuyn
CULGg531.Attributed Title:
Hic incipit pasio domini nostri ihesu cristi (f. 167); Explicit
                        passio deomini nostri ihesu cristi (f. 189v)
CULGg531.Editions:
Foster,  Frances Allen,
                        ed.  
             The Northern Passion.
EETS
         o.s. 145, 147 (1913, 1916); repr. 1971: (with collation of other MSS)..

CULIi49.First Lines:
Lysten alle I wylle ȝou telleOf mekyl peyns I may ȝou
                    spelle…
CULIi49.Last Lines:
…Wyth outen ende yere Inne to beAmen seyth alle for
                    charyte
CULIi49.Attributed Title:
Here endyth the Passyoun of ou lorde cryste Ihesu lorde Ihseu þi
                    blyssyd lyfe. helpe & conforte our wreched lyfe. Amen (f. 42)

BLCottVesDIX.First Lines: …Ye clepyth me yowre lorde allye wete neuer what schall befallThow y be lorde & maister alsoBefore yow y have knelyd to…
BLCottVesDIX.Last Lines: …He seyde this ys nott thi dedeThat y Comaundyt or y yede…
BLCottVesDIX.Note: Begins imperfectly with incomplete lines due to damage to upper outer corner of leaf; ends incomplete.

BLHar215.First Lines:
…And most heghest of dignite Ihesu godnesse was noȝth to
                    sekeHe tok a child þat was ful meke And sete hit doun hem
                    among…
BLHar215.Last Lines:
…Ech he louede bet þanne oþer And ladde hem wiþ
                    wordis sweteTo þe mount of oliue And saide to hem alle
                    þre
BLHar215.Note: A fragment, a single leaf at end of volume: lines 300-439.
BLHar215.Editions:
Foster,  Frances Allen,
                        ed.  
             The Northern Passion.
EETS
         o.s. 145, 147 (1913, 1916); repr. 1971: 2.172-6.

BLAdd31042.First Lines: Lystenes me I maye ȝow telleOf mekill gude I wille ȝow spelle…
BLAdd31042.Last Lines: …Sall haue a thowsande ȝeris to pardoneAmen Amen par chariteAnd louynge to god þerfore gyfe we
BLAdd31042.Attributed Title: Explicit Passio Domini nostri Ihesu Cristi (after end, f. 50)
BLAdd31042.Editions:
Foster,  Frances Allen,
                        ed.  
             The Northern Passion.
EETS
         o.s. 145, 147 (1913, 1916); repr. 1971: (with collation of other MSS)..

HarEng1031.First Lines:
…To holden in her bali[ ] þat ilke
                    place…
HarEng1031.Last Lines:
…all he seyden on skorningwol come hir iewis
                    king…
